list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The mountains were dim through the haze.

list_definition.definition: to play tricks on new college students, army recruits etc or make them perform humiliating tasks.

list_ex_of_english: Eleven of those individuals face one count of third-degree felony hazing resulting in death, which is punishable by up to six years in prison.
There is a zero tolerance against any kind of hazing.
Gangs foster fellowship though the brutality of hazing and the camaraderie of drinking sessions.
In military circles hazing is sometimes assumed to test recruits under situations of stress and hostility.
Although the day used to consist of hazing instead of fun, the school has put an end to the hazing of grade 9 day.
Rewards during initiations or hazing rituals matter in that initiates who feel more rewarded express stronger group identity.
The college president typically enforced strict discipline, and the upperclassman enjoyed hazing the freshman.
Three windows were removed from the orbiter due to pitting and hazing.
